Package moulton.scalable.texts

Class TextBox

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
moulton.scalable.texts.TextBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
TouchResponsiveComponent, DraggableComponent, ScrollableComponent, HotkeyTextComponent, TextInputComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
StaticTextBox
public class TextBox
extends Clickable
implements DraggableComponent, HotkeyTextComponent, ScrollableComponent
This is a text box that users can enter data into, the available characters for which is defined by TextFormat. This class also has the functionality of mouse dragging to select multiple characters to be manipulated, and thereby offers support for copy, cut, and paste functions.

The text that is contained in the box is saved as message. A hint (if any) is saved as hint. If a scroll bar is to be associated with this text box, use textScroller.

Beyond the typical function, there are a few custom attributes for the text box that can be enabled or disabled:

  • sordSplitting defines whether lines can be split on words or only on break characters.
  • hasVirtualSpace decides whether the text box can have text in its message that is saved but not shown
  • cutOffMark determines whether the box should have a visual indication if any of its text is in virtual space.
  • charMax sets whether the text box has a maximum number of characters.
  • charMask is the character to be used instead of displaying the actual message (used for security, for example: password boxes).
  • deselectOnEnter determines whether an input of enter will deselect the text box.
  • acceptEnter defines whether this text box can have the \n character input to its message. Not recommended to be true if deselectOnEnter is true.
  • hotkeyEnabled decides whether hot keys (such as copy, cut, and paste) should be usable with this text box. All hot keys that this enables are defined by HotkeyTextComponent.
  • clickSelectsAll determines whether all the text should be selected when the text box is set to clicked.
Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Details

    • message

      protected java.lang.String message
      The display string of the text box.
      See Also:
      getMessage(), setMessage(String)

    • hint

      protected java.lang.String hint
      Displays this string on the text box when the message is empty.
      See Also:
      setHint(String), getHint()

    • width

      protected java.lang.String width
      Text boxes are rectangles, thus they will be drawn from (x,y) to (x+width,y+width)

    • height

      protected java.lang.String height
      Text boxes are rectangles, thus they will be drawn from (x,y) to (x+width,y+width)

    • font

      protected java.awt.Font font
      The font used to display message

    • color

      protected java.awt.Color color
      The background color used if editable. Otherwise, white is used.

    • format

      protected TextFormat format
      The formatting scheme for this text box. Determines what characters are valid in the message.
      See Also:
      getTextFormat(), MenuComponent.setTextResizeFactor(int)

    • alignment

      protected Alignment alignment
      The alignment of the text to be rendered. Defaults to left alignment.

    • colorTouched

      protected java.awt.Color colorTouched
      The color of the box when touched.
      See Also:
      setTouchedColor(Color)

    • bufferChar

      protected java.lang.String bufferChar
      The string measured for buffering the sides in rendering. Each side of the text must be at least half this width from the text box border. The actual padding value is calculated at render time as to scale with the component's text size. Defaults as the underscore (_).

    • showBlinker

      protected boolean showBlinker
      Whether or not the blinker is shown. The blinker will automatically blink every blinkTime ms which is kept track of by timer and timeLast.
      See Also:
      refreshBlinker()

    • blinkTime

      protected int blinkTime
      The time in milliseconds the blinker should wait before toggling on/off. Default value is 1000 ms = 1 sec. A value of -1 indicates that the blinker should not toggle.

    • timeLast

      protected long timeLast
      The last time the time was added onto timer

    • timer

      protected long timer
      The sum of time differences since last blink toggle of on/off.

    • index

      protected int index
      The point at which the blinker is in the message. Also the point where any new input will be inserted.

    • startShift

      protected int startShift
      How much the index where the text box starts displaying is shifted. If the text box has more than one row, a shift will be in rows. Otherwise, shifts will be horizontal. The shift can be controlled by the connected scroll bar saved as textScroller.
      See Also:
      setStartShift(int)

    • textScroller

      protected ScrollBar textScroller
      The scroll bar to change startShift and view text in unseen virtual space if allowed (hasVirtualSpace).
      See Also:
      getTextScroller(), setTextScroller(ScrollBar)

    • clickIndex

      protected int clickIndex
      The index of the mouse click. When the user drags the mouse, clickIndex stays the same but index changes. The selection is defined as the text between the two indices.

      Can be determined by findIndex(int, int).

    • selection

      protected boolean selection
      Whether there currently is a selection of text. Also determines whether clickIndex is relevant. That text selection can be retrieved with getSelectedText().

    • mouseClickXY

      protected int[] mouseClickXY
      The pixel point of the last mouse click.

    • sordSplitting

      protected boolean sordSplitting
      Whether word splitting is allowed for end of lines. In other words, whether in rendering the text box, encountering and end of line will force previous characters (until a break) to the next line. Break characters include space, new line, and hyphens. Defaults to false.
      See Also:
      getWordSplitting(), setWordSplitting(boolean)

    • hotkeyEnabled

      protected boolean hotkeyEnabled
      Whether the hotkey commands, copy, cut, paste, should be usable for this text box. Defaults to true.
      See Also:
      getHotkeyEnabled(), setHotkeyEnabled(boolean)

    • charMax

      protected int charMax
      The maximum number of characters that can be held in the text box. -1 indicates no limit, which is the default.
      See Also:
      setCharLimit(int)

    • charMask

      protected java.lang.Character charMask
      The character to replace the actual message content. The specified character will be repeated to match the length of the message when shown. If null, no mask will be applied. If the character is invisible (value less than 32), then an empty string will be returned. Defaults to null.
      See Also:
      setCharMask(Character), getShowMessage()

    • hasVirtualSpace

      protected boolean hasVirtualSpace
      Whether input can be put outside of the visible box. Defaults to true.
      See Also:
      getHasVirtualSpace(), setHasVirtualSpace(boolean)

    • cutOffMark

      protected boolean cutOffMark
      If the text box getHasVirtualSpace() and some of the message is cut off in display, this will decide whether a small mark will be displayed to indicate the cut off. Defaults to true.
      See Also:
      setCutOffMark(boolean), hasCutOffMark()

    • acceptEnter

      protected boolean acceptEnter
      Whether this text box should accept 'enter' or 'return' input from the user. Defaults to false.
      See Also:
      getAcceptEnter(), acceptEnter(boolean)

    • deselectOnEnter

      protected boolean deselectOnEnter
      Whether the user action of 'enter' or 'return' should deselect this text box. Defaults to true.
      See Also:
      getDeselectOnEnter(), deselectOnEnter(boolean)

    • clickSelectsAll

      protected boolean clickSelectsAll
      Whether the entire contents of the text box should be selected when the box is set to clicked from a non-clicked state. Defaults to false.
      See Also:
      getClickSelectsAll(), setClickSelectsAll(boolean)

    • fontMetrics

      protected java.awt.FontMetrics fontMetrics
      The font metrics used by the Graphics object that was last rendered on

  • Constructor Details

    • TextBox

      public TextBox​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String message, Panel parent, java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y, java.lang.String width, java.lang.String height, java.awt.Font font, java.awt.Color color)
      Parameters:
      id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
      message - the string displayed in the box
      parent - the panel that this text box will reside upon
      x - the x coordinate on the screen, given in menu component value format
      y - the y coordinate on the screen, given in menu component value format
      width - the width of the component, given in menu component value format
      height - the height of the component, given in menu component value format
      font - the font for the box
      color - the background color for the box when editable

      y - the y coordinate of this text box in its parent's grid

      Parameters:

      public void setCharLimit​(int charMax)

      Parameters:
      charMax - charMax.

    • setAlignment

      public void setAlignment​(Alignment align)

      Parameters:

    • findIndex

      protected int findIndex​(int mouseX, int mouseY)
      Finds the index in the message that is at the point (mouseX, mouseY)
      Parameters:
      mouseX - the x-coordinate of the mouse
      mouseY - the y-coordinate of the mouse
      Returns:
      the index in message

    • getLineXOffs

      protected int getLineXOffs​(java.lang.String line, int bufferWidth, int leftX, int width)
      Gets the x-offset of where a line should begin based on the alignment.
      Parameters:
      line - the line to be rendered or to otherwise get the offset for.
      bufferWidth - the width of the buffer between the side of the text box and the beginning of the text on that line. Typically half the width of an underscore character (_).
      leftX - the x value where the text box begins. The left-most x.
      width - the width of the box
      Returns:
      the x-offset of where the given line should be drawn.

    • getFillColor

      public java.awt.Color getFillColor()
      Called in rendering. Gives the fill color of the box. If the box is not editable, white is used. If the box is touched but does not have focus, colorTouched is used. Otherwise, the normal color is returned.
      Returns:
      the applicable color for rendering the fill of the box

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g, int xx, int yy, int ww, int hh)
      Renders this text box with the provided graphics. If the box is displaying the message, is clicked, and allows virtual text, it will shift the starting position (startShift) to display where the blinker would be placed.

      Calls drawTextLines(Graphics, String[], int, int, int, int, int, int) and drawBlinker(Graphics, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int) in the process. These can be overridden to easily adapt the functionality for subclasses.

      Specified by:
      render in class MenuComponent
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
      hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

    • drawTextLines

      protected void drawTextLines​(java.awt.Graphics g, java.lang.String[] texts, int x, int y, int w, int h, int underscoreWidth, int textOffset)
      Draws lines of text configured by the render(Graphics, int, int, int, int) method onto the specified Graphics object. Called by said render method.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      texts - an array of the lines of texts
      x - the minimum x-value (the left side) of the text box
      y - the minimum y-value (the top side) of the text box
      w - the width of the text box
      h - the height of the text box
      underscoreWidth - the width of an underscore (_) according to the current fontMetrics.
      textOffset - a value to correctly center the rows of text in the box. Calculated to be fontMetrics.getAscent() + fontMetrics.getLeading() + (h-(texts.length*fontMetrics.getHeight()))/2.

    • drawBlinker

      protected void drawBlinker​(java.awt.Graphics g, int x, int y, int w, int h, int rowWidth, int blinkerX, int blinkerRow, int underscoreWidth, int textOffset)
      Draws the blinker at its correct position, computed by render(Graphics, int, int, int, int). Draws onto the specified graphics object if the blinker should be shown (showBlinker). Called by said render method.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      x - the minimum x-value (the left side) of the text box
      y - the minimum y-value (the top side) of the text box
      w - the width of the text box
      h - the height of the text box
      rowWidth - the width in pixels, of the row upon which the blinker should be drawn
      blinkerX - the offset of this blinker's x-value from the start of where the text should be drawn, dependent upon the alignment.
      blinkerRow - the row upon which the blinker should be drawn
      underscoreWidth - the width of an underscore (_) according to the current fontMetrics
      textOffset - a value to correctly center the rows of text in the box. Calculated to be fontMetrics.getAscent() + fontMetrics.getLeading() + (h-(texts.length*fontMetrics.getHeight()))/2.

    • getMessage

      public java.lang.String getMessage()
      Returns the message displayed on this text box.
      Returns:
      message

    • getShowMessage

      protected java.lang.String getShowMessage()
      Returns the message after applying any charMask.
      Returns:
      the text that should be shown for the message

    • setMessage

      public void setMessage​(java.lang.String string)
      Attempts to set message to the specified string. If this text box has a TextFormat saved in format, the string provided will be parsed as defined in TextFormat.parseText(String) and the result will be saved as message. Also, the string will be shortened to charMax if necessary and if charMax has been set.
      Parameters:
      string - the string provided as a replacement

    • appendMessage

      public void appendMessage​(java.lang.String string)
      Deletes the selection, then appends the given string into message. If the append makes message longer than charMax if charMax has been set, the tail-end of the string will be excluded. Properly handles any new line characters as determined by acceptEnter.
      Specified by:
      appendMessage in interface TextInputComponent
      Parameters:
      string - the String to append on

    • removeMessage

      public void removeMessage​(int chars)
      Deletes the selection then removes characters from message starting at index.
      Specified by:
      removeMessage in interface TextInputComponent
      Parameters:
      chars - the number of chars to be removed from the message. If there is a selection, 1 of these characters will be used to delete it. If chars is positive, characters will be deleted from right to left (backspace). If chars is positive, characters will be deleted from left to right (delete).

    • removeMessage

      @Deprecated public void removeMessage​(int chars, boolean leftDelete)
      Deprecated.
      Replaced by removeMessage(int)
      Parameters:
      chars - the number of characters to delete
      leftDelete - whether the delete should occur from the left (otherwise from right)

    • deleteSelection

      protected void deleteSelection​(java.lang.String replace)
      Deletes the selection for the text box. Assumes that there is a selection to delete. Checks whether the text box is editable before the action is performed. Uses setMessage(String), so the text must follow text box constraints of length and filters.
      Parameters:
      replace - the text to replace the deleted selection with. Keep null for a normal deletion.

    • drag

      public double[] drag​(double dx, double dy)
      Description copied from interface: DraggableComponent
      This method is called by the menu manager to signal that the mouse has moved x and y pixels since the component was clicked or last updated.
      Specified by:
      drag in interface DraggableComponent
      Parameters:
      dx - the change in x of the mouse
      dy - the change in y of the mouse
      Returns:
      an two-element array of how much change was used by the drag in x and y respectively. Any left over movement will be saved in the MenuManager and summed with new change when it occurs. This makes it possible that if the mouse hasn't changed enough to cause a change in the state of the draggable the first time, it will add up over several occurrences.

    • getSelectedText

      public java.lang.String getSelectedText()
      Returns:
      the selected text from a mouse drag. This is given by returning a substring of message from clickIndex to index.

    • setClicked

      public void setClicked​(boolean clicked, int mouseX, int mouseY)
      Description copied from class: Clickable
      Sets whether or not the component is currently selected by the press of a mouse. Different clickables handle this differently. Clickables like buttons are only clicked while the mouse button is held down. On the other hand, clickables like text boxes stay clicked even when the mouse button is released, instead changing to unclicked when the user deselects the text box. Sometimes clickable components need the exact mouse coordinates when this change occurs, thus they are provided even though they are not used in this method.
      Overrides:
      setClicked in class Clickable
      Parameters:
      clicked - Clickable.clicked
      mouseX - the x coordinate of the mouse when this change occurs
      mouseY - the y coordinate of the mouse when this change occurs
      See Also:
      Clickable.isDeselectedOnRelease()

    • isDeselectedOnRelease

      public boolean isDeselectedOnRelease()
      Description copied from class: Clickable
      Returns whether or not the component should lose focus once the mouse lets go. Some components, like text boxes, need to retain focus so the user can enter secondary input.
      Overrides:
      isDeselectedOnRelease in class Clickable
      Returns:
      Clickable.deselectOnRelease

    • shiftIndex

      public void shiftIndex​(int delta)
      Shifts the index of the blinker, the vertical line at the position where you type, by the amount specified.
      Parameters:
      delta - the amount to shift the blinker index by. This will effectively make index += delta. If the index is out of bounds either positively or negatively, it will be set to the closest usable value. This method also shows the blinker and resets the timer.

    • refreshBlinker

      protected void refreshBlinker()
      Shows the blinker. Tells the blinker that it should be shown again and that the timer should be reset to now. Sets showBlinker to true, among other things.

    • getFontMetrics

      protected java.awt.FontMetrics getFontMetrics()
      Returns:
      Returns the FontMetrics last used in rendering the text for the text box. As such, this font metrics is reset each time this text box is rendered again.

    • setTouched

      public void setTouched​(boolean touched)
      Sets whether this text box is touched. If the touched color is not set, then an outline toggle will be used to show touch. Therefore, setting the touch here may trigger the toggle.
      Specified by:
      setTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
      Overrides:
      setTouched in class Clickable
      Parameters:
      touched - whether the component is touched by the mouse: Clickable.touched.

      Parameters:

    • getActiveScrollCoordinates

      public int[][] getActiveScrollCoordinates()
      Specified by:
      getActiveScrollCoordinates in interface ScrollableComponent
      Returns:
      where a mouse scrolling action should affect this component. Normally just its rendering or clicking boundaries. int[0] should hold x points and int[1] should hold y points. The number of x and y points should be equal.

    • setCharMask

      public void setCharMask​(java.lang.Character charMask)
      Sets the mask for this text box. The masking character will be used instead of the message contents, but the mask will be repeated the number of times equal to the message length. The char mask can be set to null to have no mask used.
      Parameters:
      charMask - to replace the value of charMask
